entry.title: taking steps is easy (standing still is hard)
entry.summary:
Author: peppermintyero

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,057Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 9

Summary: “I can't be your boyfriend, Buck.” Buck tries his best not to show how much it stings. He’s read it all wrong. God, of course he has. “I'm…yeah. No, of course not. I don't know what I was-” “Because I'm not.” Buck blinks. “...not into guys?”, he asks, and it feels a little like salt in the wound to ask for clarification. But there’s something in Eddie’s expression - a hesitancy almost. Eddie scrunches up his mouth at the side, looking down at his shoes for a moment before he speaks. “Not a guy, Buck. I can't be your boyfriend because I'm not a boy.”In which Eddie is back from El Paso and it's like nothing has changed. Except things have changed. Because Eddie is non-binary.

entry.title: Behind Blue Eyes
entry.summary:
Author: l4ndozx

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,935Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 31

Summary: "Buck, are you okay?" Hen called out to Buck. "You just don't seem like... you." She slowly made her way over to Buck on the couch from the table.Buck wasn't himself. He sat there, on the verge of tears, trying to fight them back. Buck had joined the 118 half a year ago, and while Buck stayed majorly closed off to them, somehow they already knew when he wasn't himself and was there for him."I- I'm fine." Buck managed to force out, barely containing his tears.~★~Or, army!Eddie coming home fic!

entry.title: Hold the line (I won't let go)
entry.summary:
Author: An_Optimist_Prime

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,508Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 471

Summary: What happens next isn't Buck's proudest moment, and he's not even entirely sure why he does it at all. Maybe it's because he's still shaking with adrenaline, aching and freshly bruised, smoke still heavy in his lungs. Maybe it’s because Chim's been back a week and still hasn't said a word to him.But then, it could be that Buck's genuinely struck dumb by Eddie's audacity - that Eddie feels owed anything at all from him, that he thinks he can talk to Buck like that after leaving him the way everyone else has and does and will - it makes venom bubble up into his throat, hot and acrid."Firefighter Buckley to Dispatcher Diaz," he starts, his knuckles white on the radio, something mean and furious trying to burst its way out of his chest, "You don't get to say shit like that to me anymore."-Or, the story of how Buck and Eddie finally get together after Eddie leaves the LAFD and becomes a Dispatcher.

entry.title: How it Really Happened
entry.summary:
Author: naenae1985

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,253Chapters: 12/?Kudos: 40

Summary: “Please…”, he hears himself whine in a tone that he’s never heard before. What is wrong with him? “Please, what, baby? Tell me what you want.” Evan says, almost mockingly as continues to slowly stroke, squeezing every few strokes to do nothing more than make Tommy lose his mind. “Please…more. I, fuck, Evan, need more”, he says breathily, barely able to get out the words. Evan’s light touches drive him more and more out of his mind with arousal. Or Buck has always had complicated relationships. He knows this one will be just as complicated, if not more than others, but he also knows it will be worth every bit. Thinking about the past leads into the future and he realizes he's excited about what has yet to come.

entry.summary:
Author: Duochanfan

Summary: Escaping the Buckleys was easy. Finding love fell into his lap one night in Miami. Evan Buckley thought his life was made when he had met Annette. The two married within months of meeting, living happily, and expecting their first child together. Tragedy strikes when Annette passes away during the birth. Evan leaves their home with his son. entry.title: kiss me (i'm not scared)
entry.summary:
Author: lauriesamy

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,854Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 231

Summary: Eventually, so soft that Buck almost misses it, Eddie says, “We could kiss.”The words hit Buck like a freight train. His eyes widen. All he can hear ringing on repeat in his head is Maddie’s voice telling him it wouldn’t be so crazy.But Buck can’t be in love with Eddie.And Eddie isn’t in love with him.“Uh, what?” Buck coughs once he finally remembers how to speak again.Eddie shrugs, his eyes dance around the air. “I mean, I also haven’t kissed anyone on New Year’s in… God— honestly, it feels like forever. It could be nice.”Buck gulps. He has to manually tell his body to breathe. “It could be nice? Kissing me would be nice?” he blurts out.“Yeah, could be,” Eddie says, shakily. He finally looks back up at Buck, his gaze afraid.OR: Buck and Eddie kiss at midnight, but it’s not entirely platonic.

entry.title: Elves Gossip
entry.summary:
Author: sassay

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 666Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 13

Summary: “No way,” exclaimed Blair, “If it’s the kid I met at the Grotto yesterday, those are both his dads. The kid was adorable, all dressed up for Santa and wanted to see him without his dads standing guard. From memory the kid’s name was Chris? And one dad had dark hair and honey brown eyes and the other dad had dark blonde hair, blue eyes and a birthmark just here.” Blair pointed to a spot on her face to indicate the location of the birthmark. The Elves working Santa's Grotto also work other Christmas events together and when they get to have a break they gossip about the patrons - especially the good looking dads. Seems like they've seen a certain pair of firefighters with their adorable son at a few events this season. PROMPT 23 - ELVES

entry.title: Never a Frown (With Golden Brown)
entry.summary:
Author: ratking_withnotail

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 98,839Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 603

Summary: Percy Jackson was excited—genuinely excited—for the first time in what felt like years. A new city. A new name. A new face, even. The golden hair, the pale blue eyes, the tattoos that traced his skin like constellations—none of it screamed “Percy Jackson” anymore. He was Evan Buckley now, or just Buck, depending on who asked. He’d keep busy—physically exhausted, mentally occupied, emotionally detached. That was the key. No attachments. No friendships. No relationships. No vulnerability. He’d learned the hard way that getting close to people only ended in pain. Either they died, betrayed him, or saw the legend behind the name and stopped seeing him altogether.Unfortunately, he hadn’t planned on the 118.
